meanings.definition: A rare hydrated calcium magnesium phosphate mineral with formula (Ca,Mg)₂(PO₄)(OH)·(H₂O,OH)
meanings.english_definition: A rare hydrated calcium magnesium phosphate mineral with formula (Ca,Mg)₂(PO₄)(OH)·(H₂O,OH)

etymology.value: From Greek isos (equal) and klasis (fracture), referring to the equal cleavage in two directions.

usage_notes.explanation: Isoclasite is a very rare mineral, typically found in phosphate-rich environments. Its identification often requires specialized analytical techniques due to its rarity and similarity to other minerals.

readability_explanation.text: Isoclasite is a technical term referring to a specific, rare mineral. Understanding this term requires knowledge of mineralogy and chemistry.
